alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 11:41PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Calumet and southern Manitowoc Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1141 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chilton, or 17 miles east of Oshkosh, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... St. Nazianz around 1205 AM CDT. Valders around 1210 AM CDT. Manitowoc around 1225 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Brant, St Nazianz, Killsnake Wildlife Area, Kellners Corners, Clarks Mills, Madsen, Clover, Newtonberg, Newton and Collins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
